Class Map

  • java.lang.Object
    • Map

  • public class Map
extends java.lang.Object
    This class holds an array of Tiles which serve as a map for the main game.

    Map

    Date: 2016/05/18

    Version:
    3 2016/05/18
    Author:
    David White and Sepehr Hosseini

        height - the height of the map.

      • retrieveLayer

        public Tile[][] retrieveLayer(int layer)
        This method returns all the tiles on the specified layer.

        Local variables:

        temp The tile array to be returned.

        Parameters:
        layer - the layer of which the tiles will be retrieved from.
        Returns:
        Tile[][] the specified layer of tiles.

                    int x,
                    int y,
                    int layer)
        This method changes the Tile at the specified x and y coordinate with the specified layer to the specified Tile.
        Parameters:
        tile - the tile that is going to be inputted at the specified location.
        x - the specified x coordinate.
        y - the specified y coordinate.
        layer - the specified layer.

      • isFilled

        public boolean isFilled(int x,
                        int y,
                        int layer)
        This method checks whether there is a Tile at the specified x and y coordinate at the specified layer.
        Parameters:
        x - the specified x coordinate.
        y - the specified y coordinate.
        layer - the specified layer.
        Returns:
        true if the Tile at the specified x and y coordinate at the specified layer is not null.

                       boolean isClaimed)
        This method sets whether or not a certain location has been claimed by an entity.
        Parameters:

        y - the specified y coordinate.
        isClaimed - whether or not the map location is claimed.

      • isOccupied

        public boolean isOccupied(int x,
                          int y)
        This method checks whether or not any of the Tiles at the specified x and y coordinate are obstacles.
        Parameters:
        x - the specified x coordinate.
        y - the specified y coordinate.
        Returns:
        true if neither of Tiles on the three layers at the specified x and y coordinates are obstacles.

      • cleared

        public boolean cleared()
        This method checks all the CardGameNPCs in the map have been faced.
        Returns:
        true if all the CardGameNPCs in the map have been faced.

      • getOccurrences

        public int getOccurrences(Tile tile)
        This method returns the number of occurences of the specified Tile in this class. Local variables:

        occurences The number of occurences of a specified tile.

        Parameters:
        tile - holds the Tile to be searched for.
        Returns:
        int the number of occurences.

      • mapFromFile

        public static Map mapFromFile(java.lang.String fileName)
                       throws java.io.IOException
        This method loads a map from a file. Local variables:

        length The length of the map.

        s This is used as a reference to the Scanner class.

        map The new map which the file will load on.

        npcType Finds the NPC type from file to be checked.

        tile This is the Tile which will be specified in the file when setting Tiles on the map.

        Parameters:
        fileName - the file name that will be used to load the map from a file.
        Returns:
        Map the new map which the file has loaded.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - when there is an error loading the file.

      • mapToFile

        public void mapToFile(java.lang.String fileName)
               throws java.io.IOException
        This method writes a map to a file. Local variables:

        p This is used as reference to the PrintWriter class.

        Parameters:
        fileName - the file name that the map will be written on.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - when there is an error loading the file.

      • drawSet

        public void drawSet(SetPiece set,
                    int startX,
                    int startY)
        This method modifies a range of tiles based on a specified SetPiece.
        Parameters:
        set - the specified SetPiece used to modify a range of tiles.
        startX - the specified x coordinate (top left).
        startY - the specified y coordinate (top left).
